posts.post_content:
Hmm yeah, I'm gunna say that the old real dual lands are my favorite dual lands. Then fetch lands (pay one life to get \_\_\_ or \_\_\_) then these (shock lands).
  
Shock lands are better if you have a way of searching for one of types to get them such as swamp or island where as the fetch lands do not have any of these types.

Posted By: TreeTrunkMaster (12/26/2009 12:53:59 AM)

posts.post_content:
Someone has to say it: This cycle of lands is seriously overpriced.  
  
Don't get me wrong- they're better than most of the crap they've given us  
(Rootw\*ter Depths, [Underground River](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Underground River)),  
and having two basic land types is a BIG plus,  
but I just don't use these now that we have [Drowned Catacomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drowned Catacomb) and [Sunken Ruins](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sunken Ruins).  
  
*They're very good for the Modern format*,  
but if you're playing Legacy or Vintage,  
there are better options to augment your [Underground Sea](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Underground Sea)s.  
I play Vintage, and I haven't used this cycle since M10 and Shadowmoor produced options more useful to me.   
  
These aren't even close to worth what they cost- save your money.  
They'll almost certainly reprint these, or possibly print an even better cycle.  
  
The whole point of Modern is being more affordable and accessible,  
and that's hardly going to be the case when cards like this are (expensive) staples.  
The basic land types are the only reason this cycl... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

and that's hardly going to be the case when cards like this are (expensive) staples.
